questions.question: In an M/M/3/N queueing system, what does the 3 represent?

answers.a: the average number of customers arriving per unit time
answers.c: the maximum number of customers allowed in the system
answers.d: the service rate of the servers

explanations.b: According to Kendal notation 3 denotes the number of servers available

questions.question: What is the main assumption of the M/M/c/N model?

answers.c: The number of servers is constant

explanations.d: All of the above. The M/M/c/N model assumes that the arrival rate, service time, and number of servers are all constant

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a measure of system performance in the M/M/c/N model?

explanations.c: Arrival rate. While the arrival rate is an important input parameter in the M/M/c/N model, it is not considered a measure of system performance

questions.question: How does increasing the number of servers (c) affect system performance in the M/M/c/N model?

answers.c: Increases utilization but decreases waiting time
answers.d: Decreases utilization but increases waiting time

explanations.a: Decreases utilization and waiting time. Increasing the number of servers (C) in the M/M/c/N model will decrese the waiting time as well as utilization
